ENDCONTEXT
The Mona Lisa, painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century, is arguably the most famous painting in the world. It's housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris and attracts millions of visitors each year. The mysterious smile of the woman in the portrait has intrigued art lovers for centuries. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Who painted the Mona Lisa and where is it housed? What makes this painting so intriguing?

ENDINSTRUCTION

The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century. It is housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France, and it attracts millions of visitors each year. The painting's allure largely stems from the mysterious smile of the woman in the portrait, which has captivated art lovers for centuries. The enigmatic expression and the intricate details in the painting have made it an enduring masterpiece in the world of art.

ENDOUTPUT
